# Draft:Zhao Feng (art historian)

Doctor/Researcher/Professor, Qiushi Distinguished Professor, Honorary Director of the China National Silk Museum, Doctoral Supervisor at Donghua University and Zhejiang Sci-Tech University.
Long-term research focuses on the history of Chinese textile technology and the art history of the Silk Road. Has conducted visiting research and collaborative projects at institutions such as the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York, the Royal Ontario Museum in Toronto, and the British Museum in London.
EDUCATION
Ph.D., China Textile University (now Donghua University), Shanghai (1995.02–1997.07)
Master, Zhejiang Institute of Silk Engineering (now Zhejiang University of Science and Technology) (1982.03–1984.12)
Bachelor, Zhejiang Institute of Silk Engineering (now Zhe University of Science and Technology) (1978.03–1982.03)
ACADEMIC APPOINTMENT
Dean, School of Art and Archaeology, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou (2023.08–2025.06)
Director, China National Silk Museum, Hangzhou (2011.02–2022.06)
Member, Executive Board of the International Council of Museums (ICOM) (2022–Present)
President, Costume and Design Museum Committee, Chinese Museums Association/ICOM-China (2022–Present)
Professor, Silk Engineering, Zhejiang University of Science and Technology, Hangzhou (2019–Present)
Vice President, International Alliance of Museums of the Silk Road (IAMS) (2017–Present)
President, International Association for the Study of Silk Road Textiles (IASSRT) (2016–Present)
Vice President, International Silk Union (ISU) (2016–Present)
Editorial Board Member, Textile History, London (2010–Present)
Member, National Committee for Cultural Relics Authentication and Preservation, China (2005–Present)
Professor, History of Textiles and Costume, Donghua University, Shanghai (2000–Present)
Council Member, International Centre for the Study of Ancient Textiles (CIETA) (1998–Present)
AWARDS
2023  Selected as the “Annual Person for China Intangible Cultural Heritage in 2022”
2016  Project "The Reinforcement of Fragile Silk Textiles Using Grafting Technology based on Silk Peptide-Amino Acid" won the Second Prize in National Cultural Heritage Science and Technology Innovation.
2012  Chinese Silks, editor in chief for the Chinese version, the R.L Shep Ethnic Textiles Book Award
2009  Project "Weaving Technology During the Eastern Zhou Dynasty: Based on Excavated Textiles" won the Second Prize in National Cultural Heritage Science and Technology Innovation.
2007  The General History of Chinese Silk, editor in chief, First National Publication Award
